metadata.Title: CVE-2022-31743 on Ubuntu 18.04 ESM (bionic) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Firefox's HTML parser did not correctly interpret HTML comment tags, resulting in an incongruity with other browsers. This could have been used to escape HTML comments on pages that put user-controlled data in them. This vulnerability affects Firefox < 101.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-31743` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 101.0.1+build1-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
firefox-geckodriver - 101.0.1+build1-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
firefox-mozsymbols - 101.0.1+build1-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
No subscription required

notes.Note: tyhicks> mozjs contains a copy of the SpiderMonkey JavaScript engine mdeslaur> starting with Ubuntu 22.04, the firefox package is just a script that installs the Firefox snap

criterions.comment: firefox package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '101.0.1+build1-0ubuntu0.18.04.1').
mozjs38: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
mozjs52 package in bionic is affected and may need fixing.
